author: chenyj796
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell

I install the 6.2 since I have 6.1.2 installed.

Start the pwsh.exe, and wait several seconds, it crashed.

If I start in ConEmu, it shows some information as below:

------------------------------------
PowerShell 6.2.0
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.



Current directory:
C:\Users\chenyj

Command to be executed:
"C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6\pwsh.exe"


ConEmuC: Root process was alive less than 10 sec, ExitCode=xC0000005(3221225477).
Press Enter or Esc to close console...

-------------------------------

```

# Expected behavior

```none

```

# Actual behavior

```none

```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

```

comments.body: I have noticed this behaviour as well

comments.author: KexyBiscuit
comments.body: This happens from time to time here.

comments.author: msftrncs
comments.body: This sounds a lot like what I reported on #9295.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: I think we should close this issue as it does not add more information than #9295 already has

title: PowerShell-6.2.0-win-x64 crashed after several seconds
